jobs_results.title: Senior iOS Engineer (Greenfield)
jobs_results.description:
Want to get stuck into a greenfield project with a modern iOS stack?

Sick of take-home tests and lengthy processes?

I am currently supporting with a native team build and the Senior layer is going to be the initial concentration. My client is creating a new mobile offering from scratch, and looking for a Senior iOS Engineer to spearhead the build.

We are looking for someone who has been involved in projects from conceptualisation to release, been heavily involved in conversation around architecture and technical roadmap, as well mentoring less-senior developers.

The stack is inclusive of SwiftUI, Combine, Async/Await and MVVM architecture. If you have exposure to integrating payment providers or WebViews, that would be a bonus.

My client can offer between £80,000 - £90,000 (+10% Bonus) for this opportunity, and you'll be required in the London office once per week. The benefits are extensive, and can be shared in detail upon interest.

If you feel this aligns, and would like some more detailed info, please apply and let’s chat.

jobs_results.title: Global Investment Bank Seeks Experienced iOS Developers
jobs_results.description:
Job Description
">

We are seeking seasoned senior developers to become a key part of our mobile development team.

jobs_results.title: Senior iOS Developer
jobs_results.description:
Mobile App Development Position

We are looking for a skilled Senior iOS Developer to join our team in Salford, London, or Glasgow.

This is a hybrid role, where you will balance office working with home working.

The estimated salary for this position is £60,000 - £75,000 per annum depending on relevant skills, knowledge, and experience.

About the Role

You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-performance features using the latest mobile technologies.

Your primary responsibility will be to ensure high-quality code is delivered in line with project goals and delivery cycles.

Main Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and maintain high-performance features using the latest mobile technologies.
• Work with the team to build new features and products.
• Solve bugs, address technical debt, and improve how we work.

Requirements

To be successful in this role, you must have extensive experience of native iOS app development using Swift/Objective-C or Extensive experience of native Android app development using Kotlin and Java.

You should also be comfortable with Compose functional programming or Comfortable with Swift-UI functional programming, and have experience with large and complex applications.

Benefits
• Negotiable salary package.
• Flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance.
• 25 days annual leave with the option to buy an extra 5 days.
• Defined pension scheme.
• Discounted dental, health care, and gym.

jobs_results.title: iOS Developer at Tesco
jobs_results.description:
Job Description

This is an exciting opportunity for a skilled iOS developer to work on delivering exceptional applications for Tesco Technology. You will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining high-performance, reusable, and reliable code. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software design, programming skills, and a passion for delivering exceptional applications.
Requirements
• Familiarity with Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles, different architectural patterns, and their testability.
• Excellent command over Data Structures and Algorithms.
• Understanding of design for scalability, performance, and reliability.
About Us

Our vision at Tesco is to become every customer's favourite way to shop, whether they are at home or out on the move. We're a big business and we can offer a range of diverse full-time & part-time working patterns across our many business areas, which means that we can find something that works for you.

jobs_results.title: iOS Engineer: App Analysis
jobs_results.description:
As an iOS engineer, you will be responsible for improving our scanning engine, for analyzing iOS applications and automatically finding security and privacy issues.

You Will
• Work with the mobile team on a set of tools we've built to statically analyze IPAs in order to find security issues. We have open-sourced parts of our iOS static analyzer at https://github.com/datatheorem/strongarm.
• Improve our dynamic analyzer, which instruments mobile applications in order to study their behavior while running on a device, and detect dangerous actions that could lead to security issues.
• Research and build new security checks to be added to our scanning engine, so we can help customers build more secure iOS apps.

We’re Looking For Someone Who Has
• Significant experience implementing iOS applications and tools.
• Good understanding of the iOS runtime.
• Some experience writing tools in Python.
• Bonus points: experience with taking apart iOS software in order to understand and/or modify it. This includes experience with Objective-C runtime APIs (ie. swizzling) and tools such as CydiaSubstrate, Frida, etc.
• No information security experience required - we are more interested in software engineering backgrounds.

jobs_results.title: Senior iOS Developer
jobs_results.description:
About the Role

We are seeking a Senior iOS Developer to develop and maintain high-quality mobile applications using Kotlin. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop and maintain high-quality mobile applications using Kotlin
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
• Explore and implement iOS development practices to enhance our app offerings
• Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications

What We Offer

At Workonblockchain, we offer a competitive salary between £35,000 - £45,000 per year and a benefits package that supports your professional growth and development.

jobs_results.title: Mobile Engineer. (contract)
jobs_results.description:
Job Title: Mobile Engineer (IOS & Android)

Location: Sunbury-on-Thames (Hybrid)

Contract Length: 6 months

Industry: Oil and Energy, Tech

Working Hours: 8 per day/ 40 per week

Dynamo is on a mission to optimise front line operations on the planet.

Over 800 million front line workers work in heavy industry across six million sites globally. Their work is risky and complex, in often remote locations. They still deal with a lot of paper, multiple (clunky) software tools and manual processes to simply get work done. This means many avoidable health and safety incidents and enormous waste in work execution. Every 10 seconds, someone loses their life in a work-related incident. Dynamo will change this by optimising how front-line work gets planned and executed.

Dynamo's platform and connected apps allow front-line teams to plan work, perform risk assessments, request work permits, record observations, get alerted on health and safety risks in real-time (e.g. fatigue or exclusion zones), and share lessons learnt.

Why join the team:
• Dynamo is solving a problem that touches the lives of millions of front line workers globally and enables them to return home safe to their families after every shift
• We have significant pull from customers and have signed multi-year deals with enterprise customers already
• High calibre team and a culture of continuous innovation, customer centricity and fast-paced execution
• Joining us at this stage means you get to shape the product.

So, if you are someone who enjoys solving big problems, thrives on challenges and ambiguous situations, is hands-on and not afraid of executing at pace – join Dynamo on its mission to optimise front line operations on the planet.

What you will do:
• Design, develop and test new features for our expanding product suite.
• Develop features for a native mobile application on iOS and Android.
• Collaborate with other web and mobile developers as we build our server-driven UI platform
• Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle
• Work independently and own feature development from concept to delivery.
• Collaborate with the engineering team and contribute to the overall design of the system.
• Develop automated tests and conduct performance tuning
• Contribute to code reviews

What you will have:
• Bachelor's degree in a technical field, computer science, software engineering or similar.
• 7+ years experience in software development, with a strong emphasis on mobile development
• In-depth knowledge of native mobile development for iOS or Android using Swift UI or Jetpack Compose
• Knowledge of composable design patterns
• Knowledge of SOLID principles and Test Driven Development
• Experience with Microservices, gRPC, containerisation and Kubernetes
• Experience with Cloud platforms in either Azure of AWS
• Familiar with SQL and NoSQL databases
• Familiar with Agile, DevOps, Gitops and CI/CD pipelines

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs_results.title: iOS Developer Position at Amazon
jobs_results.description:
About the Team

You will be part of an interdisciplinary team of hardware, firmware, software (mobile, backend, and frontend), and system engineers developing and integrating cutting-edge technologies into pragmatic solutions for package transportation, logistics, and delivery.
Job Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.
• Mobile application development experience with iOS.
• Development experience in Swift/Objective C environments.
• Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis.

The selected candidate will work on creating innovative solutions that guide drivers to deliver packages at the right place, right time, and to the right person. Excellent communication and teamwork skills are essential.

jobs_results.title: Front End Developer Cofounder -  React Native | PWA | iOS / Android
jobs_results.description:
Team Role Title: Front End Developer Cofounder - React Native | PWA | iOS / Android

Suportr League Play To Earn Sports Fan Gaming Platform

Location: Remote / Flexible time

Compensation: Equity (Salary post Seed Funding)

Time Required: 5-10 hours per week (during pre funding period)

Current Status:
• Game / Platform Currency Presale (Target: £2.5M) - In development
• MVP Development in progress with a target release scheduled for Q4'25
• Game development in progress
• Onboarding C-Suite / NED's
• Sourcing VC's for a syndicated Seed round (Target £6M)

Current Team:
• Chief Product Office (Founder)
• AI/ML Developer
• Game Developer
• Blockchain Developer
• Back End Developer
• UI/UX Designer

The Opportunity:

We are seeking a passionate and skilled Cofounder & Cross-Platform Developer to join our dynamic startup team. This is a unique opportunity to play a pivotal role in the development of an innovative sports gaming platform from the ground up. As a cofounder, you will be instrumental in shaping the product, technology, and future direction of Suportr League.

Bootstrapped to date, we are pre-Seed funded and pre-revenue. While an initial salary isn’t available at this stage, we’re excited to offer equity as part of our growing venture.

Responsibilities:
• Lead the development and maintenance of our cross-platform mobile application for PWA / Web iOS and Android.
• Collaborate with the founding team to define and implement the product roadmap.
• Design and implement scalable and secure front and backend systems.
• Ensure a seamless and engaging user experience across both platforms.

Requirements:
• Proven experience in developing cross-platform mobile applications using React Native
• Strong proficiency in Web 2(/3) PWA, iOS and Android development.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced startup environment.
• Passion for sports and gaming, with a keen interest in Play To Earn models.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
• Strong communication skills and the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Why Join Us?
• Equity Opportunity: As a cofounder, you will receive an equity share in the company. While there is no initial salary, this role offers the potential for substantial financial rewards upon securing our first round of seed funding and successful platform game currency presale.
• Innovative Environment: Be at the forefront of the Play to Earn revolution in sports gaming, working on cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.
• Growth Potential: Join a start-up with tremendous growth potential, where your contributions will directly impact the success and direction of the company.
• Passionate Team: Work with a team of enthusiastic and dedicated individuals who share your passion for sports, gaming, and technology.

How to Apply: If you are excited about this opportunity and believe you have the skills and passion to join our team, we would love to hear from you. Please apply on linkedIn or send your resume detailing your relevant experience and why you are interested in joining Suportr League, and any relevant portfolio or project links to hr@suportr.com (remember to add the email Subject: “Cofounder & Cross-Platform Developer”)

Join us at Suportr League and help us redefine the future of sports fan engagement and gaming!

Suportr League is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

jobs_results.title: iOS Application Developer with Swift Expertise
jobs_results.description:
Job Description

We are looking for a skilled iOS Engineer to join our Customer Experience team, who will contribute to the success of our iPhone and iPad app. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in developing high-quality iOS applications using Swift and Xcode.

The selected individual will be responsible for designing and implementing clean and user-friendly interfaces, working closely with our design team to ensure alignment with Apple's HIG guidelines. A strong focus on code quality, testing, and performance is essential for this role.

We offer a competitive salary of £70,000 - £90,000 per annum, depending on experience, as well as a range of benefits including flexible working hours, employee discounts, and access to professional development opportunities.
Responsibilities
• Design and implement iOS applications using Swift and Xcode
• Collaborate with the design team to create visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces
• Write efficient, testable, and maintainable code
• Participate in code reviews and contribute to the improvement of the codebase
